courseDescription: Laboratory experience in the screening of gynecological smears.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: N/A
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Identifying abnormalities in gynecological samples
Troubleshooting technical issues in screening processes

courseDescription: This course is an overview of general disease processes and causes in the human.  All body systems will be covered including respiratory, gastrointestinal, circulatory, nervous, reproductive, and urinary.  Aging, dietary, and stress factors will be discussed in the disease process.  Bacteria, fungi, and viruses will be discussed in general and for each body system.  Neoplasms will be covered for each body site. This course will be of benefit to anyone interested in diseases of the human body or entering the medical field.  (cross listed with MLS 401)
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding disease processes in the human body
Knowledge of bacterial, fungal, and viral infections
Understanding neoplasms for different body systems
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Presenting disease information
Collaborating with medical professionals for disease management
Explaining disease concepts to non-medical audiences
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing disease progression
Identifying treatment options based on disease causes
Evaluating the impact of aging, dietary, and stress factors on diseases
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Developing strategies for disease prevention and control

courseDescription: Introduction to histological and cytological features of the normal female genital tract with emphasis on normal and non-neoplastic abnormalities.  Principles of cytological diagnostic techniques will be discussed.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding normal and non-neoplastic abnormalities in female genital tract
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication of diagnostic findings
Collaboration with healthcare professionals for patient care
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Interpreting histological and cytological features
Identifying abnormalities based on diagnostic techniques
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leading discussions on normal and abnormal findings

courseDescription: This course consists of the systematic study of cellular components as well as the grouping/organization of tissues into major 'organ' systems. Additionally, the cellular basis of examples of human diseases will be studied. Microscopic and virtual identification and morphology of cells, tissues, and organ substructures will be emphasized.  This course will be of benefit to anyone interested in diseases of the human body or entering the medical field.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: N/A
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing cellular basis of human diseases
Identifying examples of human diseases based on cellular morphology

courseDescription: Introduction to diagnostic cytological techniques and pathology of the female reproductive tract with emphasis on premalignant and malignant changes.
Technical and Digital Skills: Pathology knowledge of female reproductive tract
Identification of premalignant and malignant changes
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication of diagnostic findings
Collaboration with healthcare team for patient care
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Interpretation of cytological results
Problem-solving in identifying abnormal cell changes
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leading discussions on treatment plans based on cytology results

courseDescription: Principles of diagnostic cytology and pathology of the respiratory tract, including benign conditions, inflammatory and infectious diseases, premalignant conditions and primary and metastatic malignancies.
Technical and Digital Skills: Pathology analysis of respiratory tract samples
Identification of benign and malignant conditions in respiratory samples
Differentiation of inflammatory and infectious diseases in cytology
Understanding premalignant conditions in respiratory cytology
Recognition of primary and metastatic malignancies in respiratory samples
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication of cytology findings to healthcare professionals
Collaboration with pathologists and medical staff for accurate diagnosis
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Critical evaluation of respiratory cytology samples
Interpretation of complex cytology results
Identification of abnormal cells in respiratory specimens
Problem-solving in diagnosing respiratory tract diseases
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Efficient organization of respiratory cytology samples
Leadership in managing respiratory cytology workflows

courseDescription: Introduction to collection, processing and preparation of cytologic specimens from all body sites and general laboratory procedures and regulations.  A portion of this course consists of practical experience acquired in the laboratory.  Practical experience will be perfected during clinical site rotations throughout the Cytotechnology Program. Students will learn how to properly write lab reports and papers related to health science fields. This is a writing intensive course.
Technical and Digital Skills: Collection, processing, and preparation of cytologic specimens
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication in a lab setting
Collaboration with clinical site rotations
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing cytologic specimens
Critical evaluation of lab results
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Managing practical experience in the laboratory

courseDescription: The course offers an introduction to cytopreparation and ancillary diagnostic techniques.  Upon completion, students should be able to understand the principles of cytology preparatory techniques as well as fixation and staining theory and use. In addition, students will learn the application and interpretation of various special and immunohistochemical stains, and understand the various molecular tests available for use in cytopathology.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding principles of cytology preparatory techniques
Application and interpretation of special and immunohistochemical stains
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: N/A
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: N/A

courseDescription: Study of the pathology and cytology of the gastro-intestinal tract, including the oral cavity, esophagus, stomach, colon, and rectum.  Emphasis on normal conditions, benign inflammatory, infections, parasitic conditions, gastric ulcers, premalignant and malignant lesions.
Technical and Digital Skills: Identification of normal and abnormal cells in the gastro-intestinal tract
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication of findings to medical professionals
Collaboration with healthcare team members for patient care
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Identification of premalignant and malignant lesions
Critical evaluation of tissue samples for diagnosis
Differential diagnosis of benign and malignant conditions
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Managing laboratory procedures for sample processing
Leading a team of cytotechnologists for efficient workflow

courseDescription: Study of the pathology and cytology of the genitourinary tract, with emphasis in normal conditions, benign inflammatory and infectious conditions, crystals, premalignant and malignant lesions.
Technical and Digital Skills: Identification of normal and abnormal cells in genitourinary tract samples
Utilization of staining techniques for cell identification
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication of cytology findings to medical professionals
Collaboration with pathologists and clinicians for accurate diagnosis
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Differentiation between benign and malignant lesions in genitourinary samples
Interpretation of cytology results for treatment decisions
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Supervising and training cytotechnologists for sample processing

courseDescription: Study of pathology and cytology of the breast, with emphasis on benign, inflammatory conditions,  premalignant and malignant disease in both breast smears and fine needle aspirations.
Technical and Digital Skills: Identifying benign and malignant conditions in breast samples
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Presenting cytology findings
Collaborating with pathologists and medical professionals
Effective written and verbal communication in medical settings
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Differentiating between premalignant and malignant breast conditions
Critical evaluation of breast cytology results
Developing treatment plans based on cytology findings
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leading a team of cytotechnologists and medical staff in breast cytology procedures

courseDescription: Study of the pleural, peritoneal and pericardial cavity fluids, synovial and cerebral spinal fluids, with emphasis on benign, inflammatory conditions, and primary and metastatic malignancies.
Technical and Digital Skills: Identification of cells in body fluids
Differentiation of benign and malignant cells in fluids
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication of cytology findings to healthcare professionals
Collaboration with pathologists and medical staff for accurate diagnosis
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Interpretation of cytology results for diagnosing disease conditions
Critical analysis of cell morphology in body fluids
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Efficient handling and processing of body fluid samples
Leadership in managing cytology workflow for timely diagnosis

courseDescription: Study of the pathology and cytology of non-epithelial lesions with emphasis on benign, inflammatory, and malignant conditions.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication of findings
Collaboration with healthcare professionals
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Differential diagnosis of benign, inflammatory, and malignant conditions
Critical evaluation of cytology results

courseDescription: Study of specialized collection techniques, processing and diagnosis of fine needle aspirations from various body sites, including thyroid, liver, lymph nodes, pancreas, lung, mediastinum,  salivary gland, and ovary.  Clinical practical application of these principles will be continued at the clinical sites.
Technical and Digital Skills: Clinical application at various body sites
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: N/A
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Critical evaluation of samples
Differentiation of sample types
Interpreting diagnostic results

courseDescription: Study of specialized collection techniques, processing and diagnosis of fine needle aspirations from various body sites, including kidney, retroperitoneum, breast, soft tissue, bone, eye, central nervous system, and skin. Clinical practical application of these principles will be continued at the clinical sites.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: N/A
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Critical evaluation of fine needle aspirations
Diagnosis interpretation
Problem-solving in clinical scenarios

courseDescription: Directly supervised experience in a clinical setting:  includes evaluation of gynecologic  smears and study set assignments.  Students will be exposed to cytopreparatory techniques.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with supervisors and colleagues
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Critical evaluation of cytology samples
Problem-solving in cytopreparatory techniques
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Time management for study set assignments

courseDescription: Directly supervised experience in a clinical setting.  Includes evaluation of gynecologic and non-gynecologic specimen slides and study set assignments.  Students will pre-screen gynecologic and non-gynecologic smears and study set assignments.  Students will be exposed to cytopreparatory techniques.
Technical and Digital Skills: Evaluation of gynecologic and non-gynecologic specimen slides
Pre-screening of gynecologic and non-gynecologic smears
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with supervisors and colleagues
Collaboration in a clinical setting
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Critical evaluation of specimen slides
Problem-solving in cytopreparatory techniques
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Time management in a clinical setting
Taking initiative in study set assignments

courseDescription: Directly supervised experience in a clinical setting. Includes evaluation of gynecologic and non-gynecologic smears and study set assignments.  Students will be exposed to cytopreparatory techniques.
Technical and Digital Skills: Evaluation of gynecologic and non-gynecologic smears
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: N/A
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: N/A

courseDescription: Independent study of selected topics in clinical cytology. Review of cytologic specimens from various body sites
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective presentation of cytologic findings
Collaboration with healthcare professionals for specimen review
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Identification of abnormal cells in cytologic specimens
Critical evaluation of cytologic findings
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Organizing and managing cytology research projects

courseDescription: Supervised experience consists of clinical cases and seminar presentations into current advances within the specialty of clinical cytology.  A student research project and oral presentation of current journal articles and the research paper are required.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective seminar presentations
Collaboration on student research project
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Critical evaluation of clinical cytology cases
Analyzing current advances in cytology specialty

Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective team communication in virtual environments
Presentation of complex technical concepts to non-technical audiences
Active listening during group discussions
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Root cause analysis for technical issues
Optimization of code for performance improvement
Debugging and troubleshooting software problems
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Prioritizing tasks in a fast-paced environment

courseDescription: The course is a comprehensive review course that includes the review and study of the exfoliative and non-exfoliative (including fine needle aspirations) cytomorphologic features of neoplastic and non-neoplastic lesions of the female genital tract, respiratory tract, urinary tract, body fluids, lymph nodes, thyroid, salivary glands, pancreas and biliary tract, the diagnostic pitfalls associated with the various body sites, the appropriate use of ancillary techniques in diagnostic cytology, the principles of quality assurance, and the new developments in the field of cytopathology.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication of cytological findings
Collaboration with healthcare professionals for accurate diagnosis
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Critical evaluation of cytomorphologic features
Diagnostic pitfalls identification and resolution
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Organizing and managing cytology review sessions
